Package org.yesworkflow.config

Class YWConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.yesworkflow.config.YWConfiguration

  • public class YWConfiguration
extends Object
    Class responsible for storing and retrieving configuration settings used for customizing runs of YesWorkflow.

    An instance of YWConfiguration can be thought of as a tree of configuration setting names and values. It is represented as an arbitrarily nested table of setting lookup tables. Each node in the tree has a name and a value; a leaf node stores a single configuration setting, and each internal node stores a set of configuration settings in a (more deeply) nested setting table.

    The full name of any configuration setting stored at a leaf node is the dot-delimited concatenation of individual node names leading from the root to the leaf. The root node has no name.

    For example, a value 'TB' assigned to the property 'graph.layout' is stored in a setting table entry with key 'layout' and value 'TB'. The setting table containing this entry is stored as the value of an entry in the root setting table and is associated with the key 'graph'.

    Configuration settings can be assigned by providing the full name of the setting along with the value to assign to the setting. This class will create intermediate setting tables as needed to store the value at the correct position in the tree. Setting values can be retrieved in the same way, by providing the full name of the setting to be retrieved. The class will navigate the tree of setting tables to retrieve the setting value.

    Configuration settings can be loaded in bulk either from a YAML file, via the fromYamlFile() static factory method, or from Java-style properties files, via the applyPropertyFile() instance method. The nested structure of an input YAML file is preserved and becomes the structure of the YWConfiguration tree. Entries loaded from a Java property files are assigned individually to the configuration when loaded. Because loading a YAML file will overwrite existing settings, only one such file can be loaded, and only before configuration settings from other sources are applied.

    Limitations: YWConfiguration uses instances of LinkedHashMap to represent setting tables. Consequently, an instance of LinkedHashMap may not used as the value for a setting. Further, because the Yaml class used to read YAML files also represents maps using LinkedHashMap, any maps defined in an input YAML file are considered to be setting tables rather than setting values.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY_VALUE

        public static String EMPTY_VALUE
        Configuration setting value representing the presence of a setting with no value asssigned. This is used to represent settings values derived from command-line options that take no value argument.

    • Method Detail

      • fromYamlFile

        public static YWConfiguration fromYamlFile​(String yamlFile)
                                    throws FileNotFoundException
        Factory for creating a YWConfiguration instance initialized with the contents of the given YAML file.
        Parameters:
        yamlFile - The name of the YAML file to load.
        Returns:
        The new YWConfiguration instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the yamlFile argument is null.
        FileNotFoundException - If the specified YAML file does not exist.

      • fromYamlStream

        public static YWConfiguration fromYamlStream​(InputStream yamlStream)
        Factory for creating a YWConfiguration instance initialized with YAML-formatted text read from a provided input stream.
        Parameters:
        yamlStream - The input stream from which to read the YAML.
        Returns:
        The new YWConfiguration instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the yamlStream argument is null.

      • applyPropertyFile

        public void applyPropertyFile​(String propertyFile)
                       throws IOException,
                              YWToolUsageException
        Load settings from a Java property file.
        Parameters:
        propertyFile - The name of the property file to load.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the propertyFile argument is null.
        FileNotFoundException - If the specified property file does not exist.
        IOException - If an error occurs reading the property file.
        YWToolUsageException - If the setting name indicates a leaf node is internal.

      • applyOptions

        public void applyOptions​(List<?> options)
                  throws YWToolUsageException
        Applies a list of configuration options. Each element of the list must be a String representing a YW command-line configuration option and have the form settingName or settingName=settingValue.
        Parameters:
        options - The list of configuration options to apply.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the options argument is null or not all elements of options are of type String.
        YWToolUsageException - If one of the option strings is not of the correct form.

      • applyOption

        public void applyOption​(String option)

        Parameters:
        option - The configuration option to apply.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the option argument is null.
        YWToolUsageException - If the option string is not of the correct form.
